meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a factor.
meanings.sent1: In the company, his factorship as a decision-maker was crucial.
meanings.sent2: Her factorship in the project team helped streamline the process.
meanings.sent3: The factorship of the lead scientist made the lab experiments run smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The factorship of the captain guided the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The factorship of the queen bee ensured the hive's survival.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a factor.
meanings.sent1: His factorship in negotiations led to a successful deal.
meanings.sent2: The factorship of the mediator helped resolve the conflict peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The factorship of the referee kept the game fair and square.
meanings.sent4: Her factorship in decision-making was evident in the positive outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The factorship of the guide ensured everyone stayed on the right path.

meanings.definition: The role or function of a factor.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the factorship of each team member is essential for success.
meanings.sent2: The factorship of communication in relationships cannot be underestimated.
meanings.sent3: The factorship of luck in the game seemed to favor the underdog.
meanings.sent4: His factorship as a mentor inspired many young professionals.
meanings.sent5: The factorship of trust in a partnership is the foundation of collaboration.
